DOC.brief_summary: Study quality relationship couple affect Urge Urinary Incontinence ( UUI ) identify treatment may improve relationship .
DOC.brief_title: Incontinence & Intimate Partners : Assessing Contribution Treatment
DOC.detailed_description: The importance study characterize , use validate , quantifiable method quality relationship couple affect UUI identify role treatment play improve relationship . Our central hypothesis UUI negative impact upon emotional physical well-being relationship effective treatment result improvement area relationship detrimentally affect UUI . Understanding UUI context couple , particularly perspective male partner , improve ability holistically treat UUI , thus improve patient outcome satisfaction .
DOC.criteria: Women eligible inclusion study : Age â‰¥ 18 year , In relationship male partner least 3 month , Not pregnant ( pregnancy test do study enrollment ) planning become pregnant , Have diagnosis UUI Mixed Urinary Incontinence , urge predominant , base upon 3 day void diary , Are interested medical management symptom candidate Vesicare , Able provide inform consent complete write questionnaire . Post Voided Residual > 200 ml initial visit Significant outflow obstruction Persistent/recurrent Urinary Tract Infection Bladder stone A diagnosis chronic interstitial cystitis Undergone pelvic irradiation Current pelvic malignancy Narrow angle glaucoma Urinary gastric retention Current use tricyclic antidepressant A neurologic diagnosis could affect bladder function ( MS ) A diagnosis chronic pelvic pain An active psychotic disorder Or partner nonEnglish speaking Decline permission study team approach partner regard participation
